answers.answer: Refugees from Ukraine can get free medical tests by having a referral ticket from a family medicine doctor or specialist doctor contracted with a health insurance company, and by going to a laboratory that also has a contract with a health insurance company.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/laboratory-analysis and read the section under 'How and where to take tests for free'.

answers.answer: Available medical tests include hematological, serum, urine, immunological, microbiological analyses, examination of sampled tissues, the Papanicolaou test, and imaging investigations like radiology, ultrasounds, doppler, CT, MRI, scintigraphy, and angiography.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/laboratory-analysis and read the section under 'Patients can benefit from different categories of laboratory analyses, such as:'.

answers.answer: To benefit from free medical investigations, patients must have a referral ticket from a family medicine doctor or specialist doctor who has a contract with a health insurance company, and they must go to a laboratory that also has a contract with a health insurance company.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/laboratory-analysis and read the section under 'How and where to take tests for free'.

answers.answer: A referral ticket for medical tests can be obtained from a family medicine doctor or a specialist doctor who has a contract with a health insurance company.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/laboratory-analysis and read the section under 'How and where to take tests for free'.

answers.answer: Referral tickets are issued by a family medicine doctor or a specialist doctor who has a contract with a health insurance company.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/laboratory-analysis and read the section under 'How and where to take tests for free'.

answers.answer: One can find laboratories contracting with health insurance by accessing the CNAS website (www.cnas.ro) and navigating through the 'Informații Furnizori' menu to 'Rapoarte online furnizori' and then 'Raportare paraclinic – vezi mai mult', or by checking the web pages of health insurance companies.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/laboratory-analysis and read the section under 'List of laboratories that have contracts with health insurance companies'.

answers.answer: The CNAS website provides contact details of medical providers, a list of laboratories that have contracts with health insurance companies, and the funds available for each laboratory.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/laboratory-analysis and read the section under 'List of laboratories that have contracts with health insurance companies'.

answers.answer: A referral ticket for laboratory investigations is valid for 30 days, but for chronic diseases or analyses involving tissue collection, its validity extends up to 90 days.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/laboratory-analysis and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: If investigations cannot be carried out right away, the laboratory has an obligation to schedule the patient during the validity period of the referral ticket.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/laboratory-analysis and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: If a patient refuses a scheduled appointment, the laboratory returns the referral ticket so the patient can present it to another investigation laboratory.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/laboratory-analysis and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Priority investigations are for patients with COVID-19 (after leaving hospital or ending isolation), oncological diseases, diabetes, rare diseases, cardiovascular diseases, cerebrovascular diseases, and neurological diseases.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/laboratory-analysis and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Investigations are covered even if the contract value is exceeded for monitoring patients with specific chronic conditions (if specified on the referral note) and for preventive consultations recommended by a family medicine doctor for patients over 40 years old.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/laboratory-analysis and read the page carefully.
